resources.string: If any, mark what risk groups you belong to:
Answer according to your isolation conditions:
Do you live alone or are you able to isolate yourself from the people who live with you?
Can you have access to food resources for more than a week without leaving your home?
If any, mark which symptoms you have:
Have you or someone who lives with you had contact with a person who may be infected?
Have you or someone who lives with you traveled to a country or area with a high risk of contamination?
Please answer according to your recent history:

Since you have symptoms, it is best to stay separate from people, even inside your home, as much as possible

Keep monitoring your symptoms, and if they get worse, consider calling your doctor or the emergency hotline 911

You can also use our daily COVID-19 table to help monitor yourself

Even with no symptoms, you might have contracted COVID-19 from people with whom you had contact

But don't worry! you do not need to go to a hospital unless symptoms start to appear

Going to the hospital now is also a risk, as you can be exposed to the virus if you don't already have it. Try to isolate yourself for a few days and you'll probably be fine

It\'s better to call your doctor, or the emergency hotline 911, to get medical assistance and take a COVID-19 test\n\nBesides, try to isolate yourself as much as possible, and if you have symptoms, try to monitor them. You can use our daily COVID-19 table to help you do it

You probably don't have COVID-19, so you don't have to worry

However, it's better to avoid contact with people who may be infected, as well as agglomerations

When going outside, remember to wear a mask, and always clean your hands
Hello, I\'m your personal assistant. How are you?
